Después de jugar a la demo de forma integral y de jugar la juego completo puedo comentar lo siguiente;

El juego en si ofrece una atmosfera impresionante a la altura de otros grandes del terror SCI-Fi  como pueden ser Dead space pero en una primera vista totalmente inmersiva.

Los sustos se producen de forma continua sin dejarte apenas recuperarte del anterior , los enemigos se arrastran, caminan lentamente e incluso corren detras de ti por cada esquina que recorres de los laberinticos pasillos de este juego.

Las armas son varias hasta donde yo he podido llegar y de buen manejo, no hay que olvidarse de que el juego está aun en Early Access y que probablemente cuando lo finalicen a 100% mi analisis estará obsoleto, ya que hecho en falta el poder controlar las armas con las dos manos, es decir, con una mano sujetar el grip de las pistolas o la parte delantera de los fusiles... Pero esto estará por ver en futuras versiones.  También punto remarcable es el movimiento del personaje ,muy logrado permitiendote mover con Locomotion y no depender de los odiados Teleports, al mismo modo no me convence el movimiento rotacional de 45º que ofrecen para el desplazamiento de la cámara (para los que no tenemos sensores en 360º) 

La experiencia es realmente y yo personalmente lo puedo recomendar , esta a la altura de otros grandes RV, teniendo en cuenta que aun no hay grandes empresas que se quieran mojar en el tema y las que van saliendo son pequeños grupos Indie como es el caso, aunque esto tiene mas pinta de triple A que de indie todo sea dicho.

39340975.review:
Disclaimer: Early Access Review! Subject to change as the game gets more polished.

Allow me to start by saying that [i]A-Tech Cybernetic (ATC)[/i] is a worthy opponent for [i]DOOM VFR[/i], and I have played the hell out (pun intended) of the latter. For being an Early Access VR title, [i]ATC[/i] showcases a pretty polished experience in every single one of its gameplay elements and being the devs so responsive about their community feedback could make this title stand out among the very best of VR.

[i]A-Tech Cybernetic[/i] puts you inside the body of a former scientist, and I mean that in a literal way. You will posess him, and he will complain about it being your "conscience", a voice in your head that will give you advice about your surroundings along with a balanced mix of complaints, humour, sarcasm, lore explanations, and sometimes 4th wall-breaking comments. Your objective is clear: Escape from the A-Tech facilities alive.

Gameplay-wise, this game is reminiscent of how [i]Doom 3[/i] should be if it gets a VR remake. [i]Doom VFR[/i] is a frenetic gun & run experience, something that [i]ATC[/i] is not, and I like it because of that. [i]A-Tech Cybernetic[/i] offers a slower pace version of its counterpart, where not every single room has to be a combat area. Also, [i]ATC[/i] features a set of jumpscares and unsettling moments that will give you goosebumps at certain times. As I wrote before, it is an atmospheric horror shooter, much like how the original [i]Doom 3[/i] was conceived.

[i]ATC[/i] also features a nice set of different enemies and weapons. Each enemy has an attack pattern that you should learn in order to escape an ambush or a massive attack. Also, you will have a versatile arsenal that will make your life easier if you manage your ammo. Should you get a second gun because you have a lot of ammo, or maybe you will risk to take up a machine gun, despite its high-consumption bullet rate? Strategy is something to take in account inside a facility that is crawling up with monsters that want to eat your brains out.

Graphics are gorgeous, even in their current state. Lightning and particle effects, combined with high-quality meshes and animations, achieve a futuristic, yet opresive atmosphere. Something that, for an Early Access title, is not an easy task.

The sound quality is also pretty good. The ambience music and the environmental effects perfectly fit the dark sci-fi mood of the game, and I have to confess that I found myself turning around more than a few times because of hearing something at my back.

VR-related, it features both teleporting and a locomotion system using one of the trackpads. You can holster two weapons and take another two with you in each one of your hands, although you will have to drop one momentarily to pick up any other item. To reload, you just have to move your weapons to the ammo belt, making it a fast and intuitive way of managing your magazines. [i]A-Tech Cybernetic[/i] features close combat techniques and weapons, wheter hitting an enemy with your bare fists or with a metal bar is just a matter of choice. Finally, it also allows to launch grenades by picking up one, pulling out its ring and throwing it away, releasing a big ka-boom that might save your life if you ran out of ammo.

I totally recommend this game for its current price, even being in Early Access. I am eager to see what the devs have in storage for us at the A-Tech facilities, because everything I have seen so far looks promising.

39277142.review:
My first impression of A-Tech Cybernetic. (Early Access)

A narrative-driven full locomotion/teleportation shooter available on Steam VR for the Oculus Rift and HTC Vive.

Great voice acting.
Great asset/character design.
Awesome graphics.

Love the concept – trapped in the Antagonist’s head.

The mild tongue-in-cheek humor brings balance to the scarier, more intense moments of the game.

The “voice” assists with the current mission, directing the player in a humorous/aggressive manner.

Navigate through a map, directed by a voice in my mind (or vice-versa, lol).

Encounter a barrier of some sort, get directed by the “voice”, fight monsters on the path, encounter a terminal and enter a puzzle mini-game, then proceed down the route to the next barrier.

Looting is a vaguely strong dynamic in the game, as ammo and life can be an issue.

You must actively holster your weapons, and will lose your weapon if you drop it and walk away.

You can directly pick up, or “force-grab” ammo, health, armor, and weapons.

You drop these items into your waist and leg holsters.

Combat involves melee and ranged – no scopes, sticking to iron-sights on the weapons.

I encountered an iron pipe, crowbar, shotgun, pistol, machine-gun, grenade, and “dark” variants of a few weapons. Time slowed down twice during my gameplay, but both times were narrative driven, activated by the voice in my head. There is no way to directly slow down time. It would be nice to do this as a power, perhaps.

You find yourself moving around a level, picking up ammo, finding and holstering appropriate weapons, and looking for keycards. The design on the key-cards is pretty cool.

There are scary and intense moments as enemy numbers can get overwhelming, or the area can get pitch black. The sound of a door closing is the spookiest thing in the world.

The game feels like a futuristic house-of-the-dead mixed with Doom.

Features a Mission mode and “Swarm” (wave) mode.

-------------------------------------------------
Overall, I recommend this game - it has a great creepy vibe highlighted by the narration to balance things out. I love the graphics and the theme of the entire environment. A very visceral journey into the bowels of some un-godly facility. I look forward to updates as they come, as the game is still in Early Access. Can't wait to master this game!

39256591.review:
A solid, and creepy, story based FPS that felt more Doom like than Doom in some parts. 

https://youtu.be/GDCrLgSFaS8

A-Tech Cybernetic starts you off with a Solid tutorial that runs down the basics of the game. Not much to say here. It did its job.

Reloading mechanics were not as in depth as I was expecting however the combat was fairly arcadey. More Raw Data than Onward or H3vr. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, just some of the wording had my expectations set differently.

A-Tech Cybernetic uses both Teleport and Trackpad locomotion. Teleport feels a bit more like a way to climb over obstacles than a standard locomotion option however I didn't try to play pure teleporter. I do like both options available at all times though as there are situations where a good teleport can be extremely convenient or life saving.

Unfortunately waggling seems to be at least partially effective with melee weapons however the number of enemies and the number of ammo drops you get make this somewhat of a moot point. Also, while I can technically waggle and do damage, a full bodied swing carries a lot more force with it. Enoug to lift enemies off their feet and send them flying. So while you CAN do it, you're not really rewarded for it. This seems acceptable to me.

The light play in spots was really well done and I would have liked to see more of this used. Dark tunnels and glowing eyes make for some creepy firefights.

Overall the atmosphere of the game was very creepy and had me jumping at every closing door sound. Even managing to legitimately scare me when the teleporters showed up. I don't jump easily so props to the designer who placed that surprise there.

I loved the voice acting and by that I mean I hated the guy stuck in my head. Which as far as I'm concerned is how you're supposed to feel about the guy so great job there.

My biggest complaint/request is that: Holsters need haptic feedback to inform you that you've placed your weapon in the appropriate slot for holstering your weapon. Too many times did I drop my weapon to the floor when i thought I should have holstered it. A simple, on enter volume, vibrate for a half second line of code would go a huge way towards QoL improvement.

I would have also liked to see a two handed grip for the rifle. Even if it didn't provide a benefit. It just feels better.

While very well done, the chapters feel fairly short. The current story content is on the light side at the moment. You're buying into the promise of future free content updates. This has it's pros and cons and depends on your past experiences... You're going to get about an hour and a half to 2 hours give or take depending on how much you rush vs explore. I tend to explore more and want to see all the things. Someone who just wants to rush the game is going to probably be able to clock in around an hour or so. Thus is the risk and drama of EA.

The swarm mode seems like it could be fun if they added a multiplayer component to it but I don't see myself spending a lot of time in there. I strongly prefer the story content.

Ultimately I had a hell of a lot of fun with this game. I can't wait to explore the rest of this story. XReal Games. More please. Now.

It's very irritating and breaks the spookiness. The other thing is, that i found it very boring, nothing really happens. Zombies are waiting behind doords, some of them walks and some runs.. The random enemy teleportation spawning was a big let down, i clean a room, coming out, then a zed is teleportating right into my neck, when i'm turning, it's already standing in my face, my hand go through it and i pump the bullets into the wall.....while gunplay is ok, more holster option would be good, also a mount option for the torch. 얼리 액세스 상태이지만 다른 게임들과 마찬가지로 풀버젼인것 마냥 다룰 것이며 완벽하게 주관적인 입장으로 작성하겠습니다.

한줄 의견: 스웜모드가 게임을 살렸다.
두줄 의견: 둠의 저렴한 버젼. 하지만 킬링플로어에 더 가깝다.

참고: VR게임이다 보니 VR 헤드셋에서 상단의 스크린 샷과 동일한 퀄리티가 나오진 않습니다. 제일 첫번째 트레일러 영상에서 처럼 기둥 뒤로 순간이동 하진 않습니다.

https://youtu.be/Q4YoHU6z3ng

본 내용:
이 게임은 두 가지 모드가 있습니다. '대체 내가 왜 여기에 있는거지?(스토리 모드)'와 '재장전 없는 콜옵 좀비 VR(스웜모드)'입니다.

스토리는 뜬금없이 어떤 미래 과학시설의 누군가의 몸을 조종하게되는 알수 없는 존재로 시작합니다. 원래 몸의 주인은 요대를 차고 있는걸 보아 과학자는 아닌것 같은데 자신이 계속 과학자 인것마냥 예기합니다. 여러 떡밥을 던져서 무슨 일이 일어났었다는 보여주지면 왜 그런 일들이 일어나는지는 절대 설명해 주고 있지 않습니다.
생각보다 '오 이런 방식의 접근은 신선한데?'와 같은 반응이 많이 나오긴 했으나 그것도 잠깐이며 곧 지루함과 귀찮음으로 바뀝니다.

자신들이 '이 게임은 스토리를 위한 게임이 아니다'라는걸 강조하고 싶었는지 어딜 가나 완벽하게 똑같거나 비슷한 감염체들이 드문드문 있으며 위의 영상처럼 우루루 나오는 장면에서도 딱히 긴박함을 주진 못합니다.

스웜모드로 넘어와야지 비로소 이 게임의 가치가 드러납니다. 마치 스토리 모드 전체가 튜토리얼인것 마냥 여기저기 처음보는 무기들을 던져주곤 쉴 툼 없이 감염체들과 싸웁니다. 콜오브듀티 좀비와 동일하게 특정 패널에서 무기를 구입해서 감염체들을 학살하면 돈을 받고, 그 돈으로 또 무기를 사서 방금 하던일을 반복합니다. 체력과 방어구, 특수능력치들은 특이하게 별도의 돈(?)을 청구하지 않고 웨이브가 끝나면 얼마든지 얻을수 있습니다. 딱 한가지 불편했던 점으로 스토리 모드에 있는 탄약 보관과 재장전 시스템이 스웜모드에선 존재하지 않습니다. 그냥 패널 자체가 무한 보급 탄창입니다. 권총 패널 앞에 서 있으면 다음 샷건으로 넘어가고도 남을 정도로 놈들을 학살하고 넘어가면 됩니다.

여러 불편한 상황과 버그들, 어색한 UI가 점수를 낮추지만 스웜모드 특유의 재미가 모든 단점을 커버해 주는 희귀한 캐이스로 좀더 나은 킬링플로어 VR을 즐기고 싶다면 이 게임이 제격일 겁니다.

39157232.review:
这游戏去年3月份刚出来时我就买了，玩了下就默默退款了，游戏不算差，只是最初定价78元人民币，以当时的内容量来说不值这个价，所以导致当时评论不多而且口碑一般，成为了默默无闻的一款VR游戏。难得的是开发者没有放弃，一直在改进，新增了故事模式，最近出了个免费的demo，玩了后发现简直是脱胎换骨！demo都能玩半小时到1小时，然后发现价格也降到了48元人民币，虽然觉得demo质量真心不错，但太多VR游戏要玩就搁一边了。

前几天这游戏开发者加了我，向我推荐他们的游戏，叫我再玩一遍demo，说比之前那版又改进了很多，我又玩了一遍，确实改进了很多，VR交互更多更自然了，画面也更好了，更吸引我想玩下去了，于是第二次买了这游戏。开发者是看到我给DOOM：VFR的评论后加我的，玩了后发现这游戏真的很像DOOM，难怪因为DOOM加我，喜欢DOOM的确实是这个游戏的潜在玩家，而且解决了DOOM：VFR的最大缺点，VR交互更好，移动方式更符合大众习惯（有平移和瞬移），可以说是部分低配+部分高配版的DOOM，48元来说是很值了，对DOOM：VFR失望的可能会在这里找到满足感。

有两个建议，瞬移时可以选择方向，这是我最讨厌的移动方式，建议提供关闭选项，我不讨厌瞬移，但讨厌能选方向，因为容易导致移动到目的地后方向错乱，好在这游戏选方向没那么灵活，不至于太混乱，而且有平移，大部分时候都是用平移，快节奏时才需要频繁瞬移，但在快节奏时会很烦，影响爽快感。库存系统只有两个插槽可以放武器，建议增加一个专门放近战武器和手榴弹的插槽。

以上两个改进后，那可以说没啥缺点了，虽然不至于很惊艳，但做得相当扎实，甚至有点大作的影子，很期待接下来的章节（故事模式截至2018.1.8有两章）。这是一个值得入手的VR游戏，建议趁早入手，完整版可能更贵。

39049659.review:
Le premesse di A-Tech Cybernetic sono, come spesso accade, un mero pretesto per menar le mani. Ci svegliamo nei panni di un bislacco personaggio che ci parla in terza persona, farneticando qualcosa a proposito di una situazione poco felice verificatasi nel laboratorio in cui l’avventura si svolge e lasciandoci con diversi dubbi sugli eventi che il titolo racconta. Poco dopo aver preso familiarità con il sistema di controllo, che include sia il free movement che il classico teleport, ci ritroveremo di fronte ai primi scontri a fuoco, combattendo contro decine di temibili robot in un contesto a metà tra il Terminator di Cameron e il terzo capitolo di Doom.

Nonostante il titolo si presenti come un FPS story driven, con mappe di discreta dimensione completamente esplorabili in cui dovremo trovare chiavi e risolvere piccoli enigmi, il cuore del gameplay sta chiaramente nei sopracitati scontri a fuoco. Questi ultimi si rivelano estremamente soddisfacenti grazie ad uno splendido gunplay dato dall’ottima responsività delle armi, un bell’impianto scenografico ed una fluidità impeccabile, contando soprattutto l’abbondante quantità di elementi contemporaneamente su schermo.

Leggi la recensione completa su [url=https://www.vr-italia.org/a-tech-cybernetic/] VR ITALIA [/url].

39035650.review: Fantastic!  Controls better than any VR game that I have played.  Graphics are great.  Monsters are fun to kill.  Store price is right where it needs to be.  This game delivers what you need whenever you want to smash, shoot and kill stuff in virtual reality.

39015197.review:
The developers of A-Tech Cybernetic have stated that they're trying to create an unforgettable VR experience.
I can honestly say that, with only two chapters out, they have succeeded a lot better than most complete VR games.
The atmosphere and level of immersion are easily the best parts of the experience. It's very easy to forget you're just standing / sitting there playing a game. The screenshots above make it look like a balls-to-the-wall action / shooter. They don't really do it justice. The trailers are quite a bit better, but still don't quite capture the feeling of actually playing it. The actual game is a lot creepier and more atmosperic than they would lead you to believe.
As far as the game itself, there's a lot of good things that can be said about it. Even the "zombie" type enemies are quite a bit more interesting as far as look and animations go. The controls are extremely precise, the guns feel great to use and the game preforms very well.
It should also be said that this is exactly what an Early Access game should be. It seems to be in constant, very active development. I guess they've even gone so far as to completely revamp all the voice acting for the story mode, and completely rebuilt large parts of the levels because some people prefer walking to the standard VR teleportation movement. The devs seem very active in the community and very open to suggestions and discussion.
Overall, I really hope more VR games turn out to be what A-Tech is becoming. If you're on the fence, you really should try the demo. I think there's a good chance you'll end up with the full game, especially considering how low the price is for what you're getting.

Love the game and appreciate the demo. Lots of good implementations. Overall feel and immersion is nicely done. With the amount of experiences out there, I have a few things I would personally like to see for me to fully recommend. 


Full locomotion. It’s almost there! Would love to see an option (keep those who don’t prefer it happy) to turn the right joystick from teleport to full locomotion. When you get rushed it would be nice to be able to pivot with full loco than have to remember to press the buttons for a turn. For me, its an immersion breaker. 
Sounds from gunfire feel flat. Voice is yelling in your ear but gun shots seem muffled and unfulfilling. I had to turn down the volume to start with the voice over. Then maxed it out when I fired my first shot to max the sound out but it just wasn’t there. 
Better use of storage belt. Maybe I would see more in the full version but the storage belt seemed under utilized. I could add ammo to it but I never needed to take anything out. Also, things like a flashlight/grenade would be great to have another spot on the vest to store. I really wanted to carry the flashlight for immersion and to appreciate details of dark areas etc. However, I also wanted two guns and had to drop my flashlight and remember to pick it up when rushed by enemies. I wish I could place it (on my chest maybe) and reach for my guns and then holster my gun to grab it off my chest rather than looking for it where ever I dropped it. Same with picking up ammo. I would have to drop something to grab the ammo and then pick up what I just dropped. It seemed like more of a chore than it should have been. 

Kudos to the developer(s) though. Appreciate the experience. I will purchase to support as I did enjoy the demo and hope to see a great experience become even better.

38708656.review:
A-Tech Cybernetic is a really nice VR FPS. The weapon handling is good, except for the missing recoil which makes the guns feel less "big". Melee is an option you always have (either using melee weapons or just your fists), but for the most part I just used guns. The locomotion system combines direct locomotion with teleporting allowing you to use both at the same time and it feels great. The only issue is that direct locomotion currently is always relative to your head, not to the controller. There are a few different enemies in A-Tech Cybernetic (I think I've encountered 5 different types of enemies) which is enough for the current 2 chapters, but for further chapters I'd hope for for diverse enemies.

The story mode is nothing special, but still enjoyable, even though the voice acting is a bit too loud and quickly gets annoying. The levels are built mostly linearly with a few detours for finding the next keycard, but you're never wondering where to go next (also because the direction of your next goal is always visible).

The biggest issue A-Tech Cybernetic currently has in my opinion is its inventory system. Each ammo pickup needs to be picked up and placed in your inventory manually and you have only two holsters available for the 4 different guns I've seen until now. Taking a shotgun, a rifle and a backup pistol with you just about works with two holsters and a hand, because you always need a free hand for picking up ammo and interacting with things. Dual-wielding the same gun is nearly impossible because there's not enough ammo to use only one weapon type and thus you need the inventory space for backup weapons. Melee weapons and grenades can't be holstered/stored in any way, so you're not going to be able to effectively take them very far when finding them.

A-Tech Cybernetic is still in Early Access and it shows, but the developer is pretty active and the issues I've pointed out here are all currently being worked on. More chapters of the story are to come, but even right now for the current 2 chapters I feel like the 15€ pricetag is definitely reasonable.

38520697.review:
TL;DR - it'd be insulting to call this just another wave shooter. 

I bought it and played the first level and a wave.
It's dope. The mechanics are solid. The graphics, while not the best I've ever seen, are very well optimized and extremely sharp and crisp. There's also plenty of pretty effects and lighting and the gibs are great in slo-mo. I'd like to see a bit more detail on the enemies, atmospheric fog, more lighting, and higher rez textures but it's already better looking than most VR titles.

There's lots of VR interactions and you can use both smooth lomotion and teleportation interchangeably which is ideal. I don't like necessarily having to be glued to one or the other. 

Great inventory system and pulling objects to yourself with telekinesis does not feel like a cop out and let's you skip all the awkward bending over of manual picking up.

The physics, while maybe not par with AAA flat games, get the job done and add to the game's immersion.

It has actual campaign missions as well as a wave mode and you can move around in both. I think this is ideal. I like playing campaign style by myself but when friends are over wave mode is more ideal to get right to the action, switch off easily, and compare high scores competitively. It needs more content but this is still early access.

It's particularly fun to beat up enemies with melee weapons in slo motion.

It's definitely worth the money, even in its current state.

38360651.review: A-Tech Cybernetic is a frantic and fast-paced Science-Fiction/Horror-style shooter. Here at VR Galaxy we were granted the opportunity to play and review this game for Free. We though this game was a total blast and a lot of fun. You can tell that the developers put in a lot of time and hard work to create the environments and make the atmosphere feel spooky and tense. You really feel like you are on a Outpost or base in deep space or on another planet. The lighting, textures and sound design are all top notch. The enemies are creepy and they run fast. There is a nice variety of weapons to choose from, including a pistol, assault rifle, shotgun, special weapon, grenades, etc. I like how there is smooth locomotion and teleportation support, so people who are prone to motion sickness can still enjoy this game, but those who can use locomotion feel more immersed. Right now there are 2 chapters to the game and a Horde mode. We played most of the 2 chapters, pretty close to the end. This game offers a lot of fast action and immersion and does a great job of keeping you entertained and on the edge of your seat....even though you're standing! There are a few things that we would like to see chnaged or added into the game. We would like to see a faster speed of locomotion movement, because when there are a lot of enemies chasing you, they can catch you too easily, especially if you run out of ammo. Speaking of ammo, we would like to see more ammo placed around the levels. Often times, it feels like you don't have enough ammo and you just die, because you are overwhelmed by so many enemies all at once. You might want to space out the enemies a little more. At times it feels like there are no enemies in some places and then there are a ton, all at once. Also, the big doors always close on you after you press the button to open them. They seem to be glitchy and enemies sometimes get stuck in the environments and "clip" out. Overall, these are minor issues and we would highly recommend this game. It has the perfect feeling of action and terror, being stuck in space with a bunch of scary beasts and we think you'll love it!

37858686.review:
In terms of atmosphere and mood, this game has what it takes to succeed.  It's a bit linear, in that aside from going up and down a flight of stairs, everything seems to take place ona level floor (kind of like Doom 1 & 2).  Having the ability to shoot from a different floor than what the mutants are on would be a welcome change.
The controls are very decent as it mixes both locomotion and teleportation. What the controls lack (for myself) is the ability to smooth turm (instead you press buttons to rotate in 45 degree increments).
The weapons, although pretty to look at, lack any 'oompf' to them; it just has no recoil/kickback to make you feel like  your handling a weapon that allows you you to go medievil on a mutant.  Whether you use the pistol or pulse rifle, it feels exactly  ther same.
Melee weapons (pipe, crowbar) are as lethal as the guns, which should not be the case.  There were a couple of hordes to where only a crowbar was needed to get the job done.  The game also has grenades you can use, but I could not find a way to store them to use later, I just left them on the floor (the crowbar kicks butt).
Overall, the default difficulty is very easy.  Only a couple of times did I take some damage, and at no time did I really feel threatened.  It took me around an hour to get through the level.
While it seems all I've done is gripe, the overall presentation is solid, and I want to give the developer a chance with Chapter 2, before rendering a final verdict.  I see good potential in this game, I hope it gets there.

36393844.review:
I do not get why more people are not talking about this - for an early access game, this is a really polished title and a hell of a lot of fun to play. It takes me right back to the excitement I had first playing Doom - only now - here I am *actually* in there. 

The flow of the game is spot on (at least for me) - bouts of intense fighting and moments where a group of the dead just jump out at you, interspersed with slower paced exploration (but exploration where you are constantly anticipating the next attack). The game is full motion exploration and the sense of immersion is fantastic, what a change from the countless stream of copycat wave-shooters.

I simply do not get the negative comments here - I think when a group of devs put so much effort and work to bring us a quality experience, as a community we should support them both financially, and in *constructive* criticism. The result of not doing so in a very fragile and unprofitable part of the industry should be clear to everyone. If we want quality titles to be developed, we should support them. This is one of the many titles that I found entirely by chance that have rewarded me with many hours of immersive game play and  given my a truly fantastic experience. 

So good luck to the devs and thanks for providing the community with a solid game with high quality graphics. I cannot wait to see what they bring up next, as the game is totally playable as it stands.

This new review coincides with the release of chapter 2. The devs have turned things around and we've got a very solid game building here. The graphics have been improved with more varied room designs and furnishings and excellent lighting. Flashlights now illuminate correctly and melee combat provide more damage.

Old review:
5.4 out of 10

Updated EA review, chapter 1 story mode:
I've just completed the first chapter; indeed the only available chapter of the story mode as now. It's okay, not great in any respect. The environment is corridors, rooms, locked doors and cyber zombie hordes. Find the keycards to unlock doors to rooms, then find the next keycard, etc... While fending off the enemy along the way. There is a story, which you get an introduction to partway through the chapter.

So far nothing to blow your socks off, the level design is average, average visuals, average combat. And the story backdrop, well that's average too, backed up with average voice acting. No major bugs, some cyber zombie pathfinding stuttering when a group of enemy run into each other or the environment. The melee combat feels weak, but you'll generally avoid that as much as possible. Flashlights are useless, they illuminate nothing at all.

I'm somewhat disapointed having previous high hopes of the potential before the first chapter arrived. The game has underdelivered, all the parts fundamentially work but all those parts feel just passible and lazily combined with just the most basic level of effort.

What a shame!

Oldest review:
My EA impression is that the overall presentation, graphics and gunplay is outstanding. As of now it just contains the wave based survival mode, and it's mearly passable. It's a worthwhile element to flesh out a VR shooter which has a story mode, but it just feels like a secondary element rather that the reason to own this game. I picked this up when the price was reduced, which at least is more fair to match the content included right now. 30825097.review:
《技术控制论(A-Tech Cybernetic)》是一款动作射击游戏。玩家是游戏世界中仅存的人类，面对四面楚歌的危险境遇，为了能够活下去，你必须拿起身边的武器誓死抵抗末世机械兵的攻击。
　　游戏机械化末日的设定，让玩家终于不用再面对满屏的丧尸了，稍微能缓解一下腐肉带来的视觉冲击。不过游戏中机器人的造型设计还真是令人匪夷所思。
　　游戏的新手教程做得丝毫不马虎，非常详细的介绍了游戏的武器、技能的操作，给玩家充足的练手时间，能够更好地在正式游戏中进入状态。
《技术控制论》评测:未来机械末世 一个人的生存之战
新手试炼弓箭射击练习
　　游戏操作简单易上手，与其他的射击游戏操作基本一致，比较不一样的是游戏中的枪械无法进行弹药更换。由于没有弹药更换的设置，游戏给玩家提供了储存枪械的设定，玩家可以在腰间两侧的位置放置两把枪备用，手上依旧可以继续持有枪械，这样的设定还是从未碰到过的。
　　游戏中获取枪械的方式也很独树一帜。在场景中墙面上的蓝色区域是枪械武器的放置处，玩家可以隔空取物获得枪械，但每取一把中间都有一段CD，要等冷却时间过去才会刷新出新的武器，所以在大波攻击到来前玩家们要储备好武器。
《技术控制论》评测:未来机械末世 一个人的生存之战
可在一定距离吸取武器
　　但游戏这一设计很影响玩家在游戏中的攻击节奏，也许是为了弥补武器的空档，游戏中还添加了动作元素。玩家可以在没有武器攻击时，利用瞬移的操作绕到敌人面前，进行近距离的肉搏攻击，也算是为游戏增加了一些动作体验，不是单纯的射击游戏。
　　开头我们提到了游戏中的机器人，其实常看动漫的玩家们不难发现，这些机器人的身体细看之下与《进击的巨人》中的超大巨人有些相似。同超大巨人身体表层的构造一样，游戏中机器人的外观也是肌肉线条分明的构造，不过都是机械之身。
《技术控制论》评测:未来机械末世 一个人的生存之战
机器人的外形设计慢慢的《进击的巨人》既视感
　　然而它们在游戏中行走的样子跟丧尸简直一模一样，近距离接触它们的时候，也发现它们的脸完全没有机器人的模样，反而更像是骷髅。所以游戏这是拿假机器人忽悠我们吗，从走路的姿势和外观上看，怎么看都像是丧尸啊。
　　除了动作与射击玩法的结合，游戏还为玩家准备了子弹时间模式。这种玩法是最适合突出游戏科幻风格的手段，让玩家很有《黑客帝国》的既视感。
　　如同枪械的获取方式一样，玩家需要在场景中找到并收集子弹时间的能量球，每个球只能提供十秒的子弹时间。玩家必须谨慎使用，因为每个场景内的子弹时间数量不多，一定要用在关键的时刻。
《技术控制论》评测:未来机械末世 一个人的生存之战
利用子弹时间迅速将敌人击杀
　　对于子弹时间的玩法，想必不用我多做解释了，玩家们一般都知道这一特殊技能的使用方式。在敌人数量较多的情况下，可以利用这短暂的时间快速地解决掉大部分敌人，保证自己不会被围杀。
　　但是游戏的移动方式确实造成玩家无法充分利用子弹时间杀敌的一个阻碍。游戏的瞬移方式本来是子弹时间最有利的助攻，结果玩家发现游戏中的瞬移不仅有CD，在子弹时间内居然还受其影响而变得移动缓慢了，感觉实在是白瞎了子弹时间这么好的设计。
《技术控制论》评测:未来机械末世 一个人的生存之战
被攻击时画面视角会变灰暗
　　除此之外，游戏在枪械的打击感上做得不是很到位，手柄震动反馈效果比较微弱，手感不是太好。反而是动作攻击和射箭部分的反馈会稍微好很多，并且弓箭不需要担心箭矢会用完，只不过操作上没有枪械便捷。
　　游戏极力刻画一个世界末日的样子，在场景的建造中加入了很多破败腐朽的效果，阴暗的画风和熊熊燃烧的火焰形成鲜明的对比，突显出战争的惨烈。玩家一个人身处这样的世界中，紧靠头部的光源看清周围的情况，而敌人双眼闪着红光在黑暗中出没并逐渐靠近你，会让玩家有些许恐惧的感觉。
《技术控制论》评测:未来机械末世 一个人的生存之战
子弹时间下的射击效果​
　　虽然场景在较暗的环境下，清晰度受到了一定的影响，但游戏沉浸感还是蛮强的。近距离打怪的时候，通过头部的光源可以清晰看到怪物的样子，建模还算精细但清晰度不是很高，尤其是近距离看的时候，感觉怪物脸上有些模糊的视觉效果。
　　游戏音效处理的比较好，配合阴森森的场景，将游戏的恐怖氛围烘托得十分到位，加上有些诡异的背景音乐，使得游戏氛围更加突出。
　　游戏整体体验效果一般，目前玩法和场景内容非常单一，体验并不完整。枪械的手感也很一般，使用起来并没有射击的快感，加上游戏中一些奇怪的设计，导致游戏目前的体验效果有些差强人意。感觉有点被游戏酷炫的宣传视频和图片给忽悠了，玩起来完全跟视频里的效果不一样。
　　目前《技术控制论(A-Tech Cybernetic)》在steam上的售价为78元。就现在的游戏体验来说，完全不值得这个价钱，玩家们需要观望一下后续的内容更新再做考虑，目前想入手的玩家需要谨慎考虑，等游戏降个50%左右的价格再考虑购买。

30759274.review: Visually is fantastic and the controls are excellent. They follow up with feedback and what was once a negative review has now changed. good updates guys.

30671801.review:
I´m surprised that this game has got so little attention. I enjoyed the gameplay a lot, and I think this VR title has great potential with future updates adding story-mode, challenges and more content. Check my first gameplay video of A-Tech Cybernetic and you may probably understand:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sp9n3edzPDE
My thoughts:
Well yes, so far A-Tech Cybernetic is far from finished as its in an Early Access stage, where only a wave-based mode is available together with a tutorial. But the wave-based mode is quite challenging after a while, and will probably take some skills to complete. There also seems to be a locked level that unlocks when you reach a certain amount of points in first level, I haven't reached so far thou, so I dont know what the locked level is about yet.

Anyway, the developers are promising both more levels as well as a story mode, more weapons and challenges coming up during april-may 2017, so I guess soon we really can see this games real potential. If you want to buy it now, or wait until then - well that's up to you, but I think definitely you should give it a try at some point.

The graphics are stunning, and environment gives you that DOOM-feeling with good immersion and atmosphere. Bullet time feature is working nicely and adds a lot when the game becomes intense, and it also look quite neat as well! Big plus for the tutorial as well, that is well-made and appreciated by most people I guess, especially people new to VR. The physics seems nice, even thou I think it will be more polished in upcoming updates as well. 

All in all, an entertaining Early Access VR experience that probably gets even better very soon!

The good stuff:
+ Graphics are really great - good VR immersion!
+ Sounds and music fits this game
+ Good weapon handling and easy to aim
+ Love the Bullet-time feature
+ Challenging after a few waves
+ Running smooth on High settings on GTX 980 Ti
+ Nice tutorial
+ Wave based shooter-mode not bad at all!

The bad/less good stuff:
- Lacks content (but updates are coming up soon with story-mode etc)
- No manual reloading with magazines/clips (hopefully added later)
- Only teleportation movement, free touchpad locomotion would have been nice
- The price for the content right now (kind of pricey for the content available today, but will probably be worth it when updates and story mode is out)

ピックアップボタンを押しているとある程度の距離までポインタが出て遠くてもアイテムが拾える仕組みになっています。これはかなり便利で、小部屋に入ったときの探索が非常しやすいです。しかしその反面、プレイ感覚としてリアリティは反比例しています。

☆ホルスター管理がすこし面倒。
両腰に二つホルスターがついており、フラッシュライトや武器を収めることができます。しかし、このホルスター少し判定が弱いのか慣れるまでは銃を地面に落としてしまったりします。手持ちとホルスターのクイックチェンジができないため、一旦武器を置いて入れ替えて...などと手間がかかります。(そこだけ妙にリアル)　回復アイテムが持ち歩けないのは仕方がないとして、グレネードがホルスターに入らないので持ち歩くためには片手が塞がってしまいます。ラッシュに備えて持っててみましたが、正直ハンドガン二丁撃ちの方が強かったです。
背面ホルスターなどもう少しその辺が充実すれば快適になるかなと思いました。


★宇宙船の中でもステージにバリエーションがあり、飽きない。
なんかゲート開けて倒して進んでの繰り返しだなー俺強いなーとか思いはじめたら暗闇エリアに突入しフラッシュライト片手では処理しきれない量の敵が押し寄せてきたので参りました...w
敵の種類もシチュエーションも増えていきます。チャプター２の詰みポイントまでは飽きることなく楽しめました。

★多彩なモード
僕の進んでいる限りでは宇宙船の中でドンチャカしただけだったのですが、PVを見ている感じまだまだマップもモードもありそうです。現時点チャプター全３章で他にもうひとつ面白そうなモードがあります(未プレイ)。ボリュームも難易度も良い感じにあるのでコストパフォーマンスはとても良いです。


と、いう感じに現時点９割満足でございます。
アップデートの方はかなり頑張っていますし、こういう雰囲気が好きな方は非常におすすめです。

39519019.review:
Some feedback. I hope it may be valuable and can help make game better:

1. Sometimes hard to holster a weapon, very easy to miss and drop the gun to the floor (larger hit area for the holster?) The same about reloading.
2. Hard to look down at holster to actually see whats inside (yes, there is also an icon in a hud, but the weapon should be observable in a holster too)
3. The very first level looks to dark with no reason. I am not talking about really dark areas where you have to use flashlight, but about regular rooms. They may look and play better if made out of light colors. And overall darkness does not makes game more scary (if that is the case).
4. Shooting a pistol does not requires actual aiming??? Was pointing the gun very losely towards mosters and still get consistant hits.
5. The game design as a whole feels outdated: going back and forth for keys is very demotivating. It may be OK to get one key to open one door at some point, but N keys in a row??! It is not 1993 - by today's standards it feels very dumb. It destroys the feel of progress and achievement. Ambushes and jump scares are not very good too. After a couple of times they just stop working on player: you see a corridor with doors and instantly know there will be an ambush. Very predictable. IMHO it is better push "shooter" aspect of the game, not "horror": it already got a lot of enemies and envolves a lot of combat - it is a shooter in a first place.
6. The feedback of shooting the gun and killing the monsters is not very good: the sound of shooting is not "crunchy" and not loud, the impacts on monsters gives very basic feedback and no noticiable satisfaction. And this is not a small detail - this is one of a core part of fun in a shooter games!
7. Melee weapon: wish there will be some indication the monster is knocked down, but still alive. For now it looks like it falls dead, but it is not. The knockdown mechanics itself is quastionable too.
8. One click to grab item and one more to finally collect? It feels excessive and does not adds fun. Yet the ability to grab from a distance is awesome!

I personally wish more open spaces, more situations when enemies walks from one side. There still can be ambushes and jump scares and they will work much better, if NOT happens in a row. And the game will not loose anything if all those obsolete door-key quests where removed!

39539004.review:
This game seems like it has a LOT of potential. I've played only a few hours, but I have to say that I'm really happy with how the game looks, feels and handles, and it is still in early access. I was looking at some of the reviews before I started mine and I noticed that some of the issues that people had mentioned were already addressed, which is impressive considering some are only a month or two old. 

The game movement is pretty good and the overall mechanics are very easy to get used to. You have transportation and locomotion movement to choose from which is more than some other games already released are doing. The story starts off somewhat cheesy, but it picks up and I feel like it delivers on a better stand alone story than even VFR did and I haven't had any of the technical issues I had with VFR either. The only issue I had were with the weapon holsters movinng with the headset and the dev already said they are working on fixing it. 

I'm looking forward to see how far this one goes, its good to see more good games developed for VR!
